data.author: Richard Whately

data.quote: There never was night that had no morn.
data.author: Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

data.quote: Weeping may endure for a night  but joy cometh in the morning.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Sadness flies on the wings of the morning  and out of the heart of darkness comes the light.
data.author: Jean Giraudoux

data.quote: Out of the scabbard of the night  By God's hand drawn  Flashes his shining sword of light  And lo  the dawn!
data.author: Frank Dempster Sherman

data.quote: For what human ill does not dawn seem to be an alleviation?
data.author: Thornton Wilder

data.quote: The weariest night  the longest day  sooner or later must perforce come to an end.
data.author: Baroness Orczy

data.quote: Beware of desp'rate steps  the darkest day lived till tomorrow will have pass'd away.
data.author: William Cowper

data.quote: Have hope. Though clouds environs now  And gladness hides her face in scorn  Put thou the shadow from thy brow- No night but hath its morn.
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: Snow endures but for a season  and joy comes with the morning.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: The morning is wiser than the evening.
data.author: Russian proverb

data.quote: For the mind disturbed  the still beauty of dawn is nature's finest balm.
data.author: Edwin Way Teale

data.quote: Hold your head high  stick your chest out. You can make it. It gets dark sometimes  but morning comes. ... Keep hope alive.
data.author: Jesse Jackson

data.quote: Each day the world is born anew for him who takes it rightly.
data.author: James Russell Lowell

data.quote: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.
data.author: John Steinbeck

data.quote: Each day is a new life. Seize it. Live it.
data.author: David Guy Powers

data.quote: We sail  at sunrise  daily  "outward bound."
data.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

data.quote: Always begin anew with the day  just as nature does. It is one of the sensible things that nature does.
data.author: George E. Woodberry

data.quote: With each sunrise  we start anew.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I have always been delighted at the prospect of a new day  a fresh try  one more start  with perhaps a bit of magic waiting somewhere behind the morning.
data.author: J. B. Priestly

data.quote: Relying on God has to begin all over again every day as if nothing had yet been done.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Have patience with all things  but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections  but instantly set about remedying them-every day begin the task anew.
data.author: Saint Francis de Sales

data.quote: Each day is a little life  every waking and rising a little birth  every fresh morning a little youth  every going to rest and sleep a little death.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: I love the challenge of starting at zero every day and seeing how much I can accomplish.
data.author: Martha Stewart

data.quote: Whether one is twenty  forty  or sixty  whether one has succeeded  failed or just muddled along  whether yesterday was full of sun or storm  or one of those dull days with no weather at all  life begins each morning! ... Each morning is the open door to a new world-new vistas  new aims  new tryings.
data.author: Leigh Mitchell Hodges

data.quote: To be seeing the world made new every morning  as if it were the morning of the first day  and then to make the most of it for the individual soul as if each were the last day  is the daily curriculum of the mind's desire.
data.author: John H. Finley

data.quote: Do not say  "It is morning " and dismiss it with a name of yesterday. See it for the first time as a newborn child that has no name.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: God had infinite time to give us.... He cut it up into a near succession of new mornings  and  with each  therefore  a new idea  new inventions  and new applications.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: We are new every day.
data.author: Irene Claremont de Castillego

data.quote: No matter how big or soft or warm your bed is  you still have to get out of it.
data.author: Grace Slick

data.quote: Spill not the morning (the quintessence of the day!) in recreations  for sleep is a recreation. Add not  therefore  sauce to sauce. ... Pastime  like wine  is poison in the morning. It is then good husbandry to sow the head  which hath lain fallow all night  with some serious work.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Do not shorten the morning by getting up late  look upon it as the quintessence of life  and to a certain extent sacred.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Let us then be up and doing  with a heart for any fate.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: He'd jolt up in bed every morning  sit quietly for a moment  and you could feel those wheels spinning in his mind as he planned his day. Then he'd hit the floor almost on the run.
data.author: Sasha Stallone

data.quote: Clay lies still  but blood's a rover Breath's a ware that will not keep. Up lad: when the journey's over There'll be time enough to sleep.
data.author: A. E. Housman

data.quote: Even if a farmer intends to loaf  he gets up in time to get an early start.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: Wake at dawn with a winged heart and give thanks for another day of loving.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: I thank You God for this most amazing day  for the leaping greenly spirits of trees and a blue true dream of sky  and for everything which is natural which is infinite which is yes.
data.author: e. e. cummings

data.quote: I get up and I bless the light thin clouds and the first twittering of birds  and the breathing air and smiling face of the hills.
data.author: Giacomo Leopardi

data.quote: I'm a most lucky and thankful woman. Lucky and thankful for each morning I wake up. For three wonderful daughters and one son. For an understanding and very loving husband with whom I've shared fifty-two blessed years  all in good health.
data.author: Thelma Elliott

data.quote: If God adds another day to our life  let us receive it gladly.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Here we stand between two eternities of darkness. What are we to do with this glory while it is still ours?
data.author: Gilbert Murray

data.quote: Your morning thoughts may determine your conduct for the day. Optimistic thoughts will make your day bright and productive  while pessimistic thinking will make it dull and wasteful. Face each day cheerfully  smilingly and courageously  and it will naturally follow that your work will be a real pleasure and progress will be a delightful accomplishment.
data.author: William M. Peck

data.quote: You should always know when you're shifting gears in life. You should leave your era  it should never leave you.
data.author: Leontyne Price

data.quote: The first thing each morning  and the last thing each night  suggest to yourself specific ideas that you wish to embody in your character and personality. Address such suggestions to yourself  silently or aloud  until they are deeply impressed upon your mind.
data.author: Grenville Kleiser

data.quote: Everyday ask yourself the question  "Do I want to experience Peace of Mind or do I want to experience Conflict ?"
data.author: Gerald Jampolsky

data.quote: It was only a sunny smile  And little it cost in the giving. But like morning light  it scattered the night  And made the day worth living.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: To get up each morning with the resolve to be happy ... is to set our own conditions to the events of each day. To do this is to condition circumstances instead of being conditioned by them.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Trine

data.quote: Today is a new day. You will get out of it just what you put into it. ... If you have made mistakes  even serious mistakes  there is always another chance for you. And supposing you have tried and failed again and again  you may have a fresh start any moment you choose  for this thing that we call "failure" is not the falling down  but the staying down.
data.author: Mary Pickford

data.quote: When you rise in the morning  form a resolution to make the day a happy one for a fellow creature.
data.author: Sydney Smith

data.quote: As soon as you open your eyes in the morning  you can square away for a happy and successful day. It's the mood and the purpose at the inception of each day that are the important facts in charting your course for the day. We can always square away for a fresh start  no matter what the past has been.
data.author: George Matthew Adams

data.quote: This is the beginning of a new day. God has given me this day to use as I will. I can waste it or use it for good  but what I do today is important  because I am exchanging a day of my life for it! When tomorrow comes  this day will be gone forever  leaving in its place something that I have traded for it. I want it to be gain  and not loss  good  and not evil  success  and not failure  in order that I shall not regret the price I have paid for it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I think in terms of the day's resolutions  not the year's.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: Every new day begins with possibilities. It's up to us to fill it with the things that move us toward progress and peace.
data.author: Ronald Reagan

data.quote: Here hath been dawning another blue day: think  wilt thou let it slip useless away?
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Be pleasant until ten o'clock in the morning and the rest of the day will take care of itself.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Today a thousand doors of enterprise are open to you  inviting you to useful work. To live at this time is an inestimable privilege  and a sacred obligation devolves upon you to make right use of your opportunities. Today is the day in which to attempt and achieve something worthwhile.
data.author: Grenville Kleiser

data.quote: Get out of bed forcing a smile. You may not smile because you are cheerful  but if you will force yourself to smile you'll... be cheerful because you smile. Repeated experiments prove that when man assumes the facial expression of a given mental mood  any given mood  then that mental mood itself will follow.
data.author: Kenneth Goode

data.quote: He who every morning plans the transactions of the day and follows that plan carries thread that will guide him through the labyrinth of the most busy life.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: A man without a plan for the day is lost before he starts.
data.author: Lewis K. Bendele

data.quote: Never be afraid to sit awhile and think.
data.author: Lorraine Hansbury

data.quote: Only the thinking man lives his life  the thoughtless man's life passes him by.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: My credo is etched on my mirror in my bathroom and I see it when I brush my teeth in the morning. It says  "Don't worry  Be Happy  Feel Good." When you see that first thing  and you reflect on it  the rest of the day seems to glide by pretty well.
data.author: Larry Hagman

data.quote: Only that day dawns to which we are awake.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: The day returns and brings us the petty round of irritating concerns and duties. Help us to play the man  help us to perform them with laughter and kind faces  let cheerfulness abound with industry. Give us to go blithely on our business all this day  bring us to our resting beds weary and content and undishonored  and grant us in the end the gift of sleep.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: A day dawns  quite like other days  in it  a single hour comes  quite like other hours  but in that day and in that hour the chance of a lifetime faces us.
data.author: Maltbie D. Babcock

data.quote: One never knows what each day is going to bring. The important thing is to be open and ready for it.
data.author: Henry Moore

data.quote: Great opportunities come to all  but many do not know they have met them. The only preparation to take advantage of them is ... to watch what each day brings.
data.author: Albert E. Dunning

data.quote: There will be something  anguish or elation  that is peculiar to this day alone. I rise from sleep and say: Hail to the morning! Come down to me  my beautiful unknown.
data.author: Jessica Powers

data.quote: The sun is new each day.
data.author: Heraclitus

data.quote: Someday the sun is going to shine down on me in some faraway place.
data.author: Mahalia Jackson

data.quote: With every rising of the sun  think of your life as just begun.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I feel very happy to see the sun come up every day. I feel happy to be around. ... I like to take this day- any day-and go to town with it.
data.author: James Dickey

data.quote: Look to the East  where up the lucid sky The morning climbs! The day shall yet be fair.
data.author: Celia Thaxter

data.quote: Each golden sunrise ushers in new opportunities for those who retain faith in themselves  and keep their chins up.... Meet the sunrise with confidence. Fill every golden minute with right thinking and worthwhile endeavor. Do this and there will be joy for you in each golden sunset.
data.author: Alonzo Newton Benn

data.quote: Today a new sun rises for me  everything lives  everything is animated  everything seems to speak to me of my passion  everything invites me to cherish it.
data.author: Anne De Lenclos

data.quote: What humbugs we are  who pretend to live for Beauty  and never see the Dawn!
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Sunrise: day's great progenitor.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: Put yourself in competition with yourself each day. Each morning look back upon your work of yesterday and then try to beat it.
data.author: Charles M. Sheldon

data.quote: The morning has gold in its mouth.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: Do you know what the greatest test is? Do you still get excited about what you do when you get up in the morning?
data.author: David Halberstam

data.quote: Oft when the white  still dawn lifted the skies and pushed the hills apart  I have felt it like a glory in my heart.
data.author: Edwin Markham

data.quote: Sometimes I have believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast.
data.author: Lewis Carroll

data.quote: The mind is found most acute and most uneasy in the morning. Uneasiness is  indeed  a species of sagacity-a passive sagacity. Fools are never uneasy.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: Day's sweetest moments are at dawn.
data.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

data.quote: All flesh shall perish together  and man shall turn again unto dust.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Oh  why should the spirit of mortal be proud? Like a fast-flitting meteor  a fast-flying cloud  A flash of the lightning  a break of the wave  He passes from life to his rest in the grave.
data.author: William Knox

data.quote: The mother of all living.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: She's somebody's mother  boys  you know  For all she's aged and poor and slow.
data.author: Mary Dow Brine

data.quote: A mother is a mother still  The holiest thing alive.
data.author: Hartley Coleridge

data.quote: Men are what their mothers made them.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: What is home without a mother?
data.author: Alice Hawthorne

data.quote: There is none  In all this cold and hollow world  no fount Of deep strong  deathless love  save that within A mother's heart.
data.author: Felicia D. Hemans

data.quote: If I were hanged on the highest hill  Mother o' mine  O mother o' mine! I know whose love would follow me still  Mother o' mine  O mother o' mine!
data.author: Rudyard Kipling

data.quote: All that I am or hope to be  I owe to my angel mother.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: I arose a mother in Israel.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The bravest battle that ever was fought  Shall I tell you where and when? On the maps of the world you will find it not  It was fought by the mothers of men.
data.author: Joaquin Miller

data.quote: Who ran to help me when I fell  And would some pretty story tell  Or kiss the place to make it well? My Mother.
data.author: Anne Taylor

data.quote: For the hand that rocks the cradle Is the hand that rules the world.
data.author: William Ross Wallace

data.quote: Sure I love the dear silver that shines in your hair  And the brow that's all furrowed  and wrinkled with care. I kiss the dear fingers  so toil-worn for me  Oh  God bless you and keep you  Mother Machree.
data.author: Rida Johnson Young

data.quote: Her children arise up and call her blessed.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Fatherhood is pretending the present you love most is soap-on-a-rope.
data.author: Bill Cosby

data.quote: Definition of Father's Day: Same as Mother's Day but you don't spend as much.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: My folks refused to have more than four children after reading that every fifth child born in the world is Chinese.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: No matter what  Dad was always there with solid words of advice . . . "Go ask your mother."
data.author: Alan Ray

data.quote: Father reading report card: One thing in your favor -  with these grades  you couldn't possibly be cheating.
data.author: Jacob Braude

data.quote: Every small boy wonders why his father didn't go into the ice cream business.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: No matter how old a mother is  she still watches her middle-aged children for signs of improvement.
data.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

data.quote: There are three books my daughter felt were the most important influences in her life: the Bible  her mother's cookbook  and her father's checkbook.
data.author: Joyce Mattingly

data.quote: Grandchildren don't make a man feel old  it's the knowledge that he's married to a grandmother.
data.author: G. Norman Collie

data.quote: Dad named his first ulcer after me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: It is a wise child that knows its own father  and an unusual one that unreservedly approves of him.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Before I got married I had six theories about bringing up children  now I have six children and no theories.
data.author: John Wilmot

data.quote: When I was a boy of fourteen  my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be twenty-one  I was astonished at how much he had learned in seven years.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: My mother phones daily to ask  "Did you just try to reach me?" When I reply no  she adds  "So  if you're not too busy  call me while I'm still alive " . . . and hangs up.
data.author: Erma Bombeck

data.quote: Most men are secretly still mad at their mothers for throwing away their comic books. They would be valuable now.
data.author: Rita Rudner

data.quote: There's no such thing as a nonworking mother.
data.author: Hester Mundis

data.quote: God could not be everywhere  and therefore he made mothers.
data.author: Jewish proverb

data.quote: MOTHER TO TEENAGER ON SUNDAY MORNING: I believe I heard the clock strike one when you came in last night. teen: Well  I know how much you need your sleep  so it was going to strike ten but I stopped it at one chime.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I hope I look as good as my mother does when I reach the age she says she isn't.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: I found out why cats drink out of the toilet. My mother told me it's because it's cold in there. And I'm like: How did my mother know that?
data.author: Wendy Liebman

data.quote: The most remarkable thing about my mother is that for thirty years she served the family nothing but leftovers. The original meal has never been found.
data.author: Calvin Trillin

data.quote: What makes life dreary is want of motive.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: They never die  who have the future in them.
data.author: Meridel Le Sueur

data.quote: As long as I have a want  I have a reason for living. Satisfaction is death.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: One must not lose desires. They are mighty stimulants to creativeness  to love and to long life.
data.author: Alexander A. Bogomoletz

data.quote: Take away the cause  and the effect ceases.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Every true man  sir  who is a little above the level of the beasts and plants  lives so as to give a meaning and a value to his own life.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: The secret of discipline is motivation. When a man is sufficiently motivated  discipline will take care of itself.
data.author: Sir Alexander Paterson

data.quote: Where the willingness is great  the difficulties cannot be great.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: Talent isn't enough. You need motivation-and persistence  too: what Steinbeck called a blend of faith and arrogance. When you're young  plain old poverty can be enough  along with an insatiable hunger for recognition. You have to have that feeling of "I'll show them." If you don't have it  don't become a writer.
data.author: Leon Uris

data.quote: Never let go of that fiery sadness called desire.
data.author: Patti Smith

data.quote: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good  and we must hunger for them.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: One man with a dream  at pleasure  Shall go forth and conquer a crown  And three with a new song's measure  Can trample an empire down.
data.author: Arthur O'Shaughnessy

data.quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. ... What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: Winning isn't everything. Wanting to win is.
data.author: Catfish Hunter

data.quote: If you can learn from hard knocks  you can also learn from soft touches.
data.author: Carolyn Kenmore

data.quote: For every man there exists a bait which he cannot resist swallowing.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: Accurate information is a key part of motivation.
data.author: Mary Ann Allison

data.quote: Football linemen are motivated by a more complicated  self-determining series of factors than the simple fear of humiliation in the public gaze  which is the emotion that galvanizes the backs and receivers.
data.author: Merlin Olsen

data.quote: Love makes the wildest spirit tame  and the tamest spirit wild.
data.author: Alexis Delp

data.quote: I tried to treat them like me  and some of them weren't.
data.author: Bill Russell

data.quote: To be what we are  and to become what we are capable of becoming  is the only end of life.
data.author: Baruch Spinoza

data.quote: I believe in using words  not fists.
data.author: Susan Sarandon

data.quote: Every man is said to have his peculiar ambition.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: The moment somebody says to me  "This is very risky " is the moment it becomes attractive to me.
data.author: Kate Capshaw

data.quote: Some people are molded by their admirations  others by their hostilities.
data.author: Elizabeth Bowen

data.quote: A man will fight harder for his interests than for his rights.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: Good humor  like the jaundice  makes every one of its own complexion.
data.author: Elizabeth Inchbald

data.quote: All I want out of life is that when I walk down the street  folks will say  "There goes the greatest hitter who ever lived."
data.author: Ted Williams

data.quote: Your distress about life might mean you have been living for the wrong reason  not that you have no reason for living.
data.author: Tom O'Connor

data.quote: Great men undertake great things because they are great  fools  because they think them easy.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: Love teaches even asses to dance.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: There are only two stimulants to one's best efforts: the fear of punishment  and the hope of reward.
data.author: John M. Wilson

data.quote: When you get hungry enough  you find yourself speaking Spanish pretty well.
data.author: Josh Gibson

data.quote: Discontent is the first step in progress. No one knows what is in him till he tries  and many would never try if they were not forced to.
data.author: Basil W. Maturin

data.quote: I never work better than when I am inspired by anger  when I am angry  I can write  pray  and preach well  for then my whole temperament is quickened  my understanding sharpened  and all mundane vexations and temptations depart.
data.author: Martin Luther

data.quote: It is for the superfluous things of life that men sweat.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Happiness is in the taste  and not in the things themselves  we are happy from possessing what we like  not from possessing what others like.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: We must each find our separate meaning in the persuasion of our days until we meet in the meaning of the world.
data.author: Christopher Fry

data.quote: Don't let other people tell you what you want.
data.author: Pat Riley

data.quote: Men are more often bribed by their loyalties and ambitions than by money.
data.author: Robert H. Jackson

data.quote: In my experience  there is only one motivation  and that is desire. No reasons or principle contain it or stand against it.
data.author: Jane Smiley

data.quote: All progress is based upon a universal  innate desire on the part of every living organism to live beyond its income.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Those who are lifting the world upward and onward are those who encourage more than criticize.
data.author: Elizabeth Harrison

data.quote: Everyone expects to go further than his father went  everyone expects to be better than he was born and every generation has one big impulse in its heart-to exceed all the other generations of the past in all the things that make life worth living.
data.author: William Allen White

data.quote: To feel valued  to know  even if only once in a while  that you can do a job well is an absolutely marvelous feeling.
data.author: Barbara Walters

data.quote: The speed of the leader is the speed of the gang.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: To sink a six-foot putt with thirty million people looking over your shoulder  convince yourself that  if you miss it  you will be embarrassed and poor.
data.author: Jack Nicklaus

data.quote: I want to do it because I want to do it.
data.author: Amelia Earhart

data.quote: Fear  desire  hope still push us on toward the future.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Money never remains just coins and pieces of paper. Money can be translated into the beauty of living  a support in misfortune  an education  or future security.
data.author: Sylvia Porter

data.quote: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire  emotion  and knowledge.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Lust and force are the source of all our actions  lust causes voluntary actions  force involuntary ones.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: I don't make deals for the money. I've got enough  much more than I'll never need. I do it to do it. Other people paint beautifully on canvas or write wonderful poetry. I like making deals  preferably big deals. That's how I get my kicks.
data.author: Donald Trump

data.quote: Wealth ... and poverty: the one is the parent of luxury and indolence  and the other of meanness and vicious-ness  and both of discontent.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Anxiety and conscience are a powerful pair of dynamos. Between them  they have ensured that I shall work hard  but they cannot ensure that one shall work at anything worthwhile.
data.author: Arnold J. Toynbee

data.quote: It is the spur of ignorance  the consciousness of not understanding  and the curiosity about that which lies beyond that are essential to our progress.
data.author: John Pierce

data.quote: We all live with the objective of being happy  our lives are all different  and yet the same.
data.author: Anne Frank

data.quote: Love teaches even asses to dance.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: Money and women. They're the two strongest things in the world. There are things you do for a woman you wouldn't do for anything else. Same with money.
data.author: Satchel Paige

data.quote: It is for the superfluous things of life that men sweat.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: It is not merely cruelty that leads men to love war  it is excitement.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: I am not sending messages with my feet. All I ever wanted was not to come up empty. I did it for the dough  and the old applause.
data.author: Fred Astaire

data.quote: My advice about acting? Speak clearly  don't bump into people  and if you must have motivation  think of your pay packet on Friday.
data.author: Noel Coward

data.quote: I take it that what all men are really after is some form of  perhaps only some formula of  peace.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: It is the north wind that lashes men into Vikings  it is the soft  luscious south wind which lulls them to lotus dreams.
data.author: Ouida

data.quote: One starts an action simply because one must do something.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: Action springs not from thought  but from a readiness for responsibility.
data.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

data.quote: The breakfast of champions is not cereal  it's the opposition.
data.author: Nick Seitz

data.quote: There's only one good reason to be a writer-we can't help it! We'd all like to be successful  rich and famous  but if those are our goals  we're off on the wrong foot. ... I just wanted to earn enough money so I could work at home on my writing.
data.author: Phyllis Whitney

data.quote: I wish it  I command it. Let my will take the place of a reason.
data.author: Juvenal

data.quote: Necessity  who is the mother of our invention.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Urgent necessity prompts many to do things.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: I always felt that I hadn't achieved what I wanted to achieve. I always felt I could get better. That's the whole incentive.
data.author: Virginia Wade

data.quote: Discontent is the first step in the progress of a man or a nation.
data.author: Oscar Wilde

data.quote: To have a grievance is to have a purpose in life.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: What you are must always displease you  if you would attain to that which you are not.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: We accept the verdict of the past until the need for change cries out loudly enough to force upon us a choice between the comforts of further inertia and the irksomeness of action.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: I can't concentrate on golf or bowling. Those bowling pins aren't going to hurt me. I can concentrate in the ring because someone is trying to kill me.
data.author: Carmen Basilio

data.quote: I happened on the idea of fitting an engine to a bicycle simply because I did not want to ride crowded trains and buses.
data.author: Soichire Honda

data.quote: Always in a moment of extreme danger things can be done which had previously been thought impossible.
data.author: Field Marshal Erwin Rommel

data.quote: Acting was a way out at first. A way out of not knowing what to do  a way of focusing ambitions. And the ambition wasn't for fame. The ambition was to do an interesting job.
data.author: Harrison Ford

data.quote: A loafer never works except when there is a fire  then he will carry out more furniture than anybody.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: Hardships  poverty and want are the best incentives  and the best foundation  for the success of man.
data.author: Bradford Merrill

data.quote: Poverty  Frost  Famine  Rain  Disease  are the beadles and guardsmen that hold us to Common Sense.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Necessity is the mother of taking chances.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: If you're good to your staff when things are going well  they'll rally when times go bad.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: Praise is the only gift for which people are really grateful.
data.author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

data.quote: I praise loudly  I blame softly.
data.author: Catherine II

data.quote: There are two things that people want more than sex and money- recognition and praise.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: To hear how special and wonderful we are is endlessly enthralling.
data.author: Gail Sheehy

data.quote: Words are less needful to sorrow than to joy.
data.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

data.quote: Sandwich every bit of criticism between two heavy layers of praise.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: There isn't much that tastes better than praise from those who are wise and capable.
data.author: Selma Lagerlof

data.quote: We treat our people like royalty. If you honor and serve the people who work for you  they will honor and serve you.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: What you praise you increase.
data.author: Catherine Ponder

data.quote: What men and women need is encouragement. ... Instead of always harping on a man's faults  tell him of his virtues. Try to pull him out of his rut of bad habits.
data.author: Eleanor H. Porter

data.quote: Everyone has an invisible sign hanging from their neck saying  "Make me feel important." Never forget this message when working with people.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: We are all motivated by a keen desire for praise  and the better a man is  the more he is inspired by glory.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: Applause is the spur of noble minds  the end and aim of weak ones.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Most people would rather be seen through than not seen at all.
data.author: Ada Levenson

data.quote: When we are listened to  it creates us  makes us unfold and expand. Ideas actually begin to grow within us and come to life.
data.author: Brenda Ueland

data.quote: Praise out of season  or tactlessly bestowed  can freeze the heart as much as blame.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: We do not content ourselves with the life we have in ourselves  we desire to live an imaginary life in the minds of others  and for this purpose we endeavor to shine.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: The greatest efforts of the race have always been traceable to the love of praise  as the greatest catastrophes to the love of pleasure.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: If each of us were to confess his most secret desire  the one that inspires all his plans  all his actions  he would say: "I want to be praised."
data.author: E. M. Cioran

data.quote: We talk on principle  but we act on interest.
data.author: Walter Savage Landor

data.quote: What allows us  as human beings  to psychologically survive life on earth  with all of its pain  drama  and challenges  is a sense of purpose and meaning.
data.author: Barbara De Angelis

data.quote: A man will fight harder for his interests than for his rights.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: The pitcher cries for water to carry and a person for work that is real.
data.author: Marge Piercy

data.quote: The virtues and the vices are all put in motion by interest.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: It's so hard when I have to  and so easy when I want to.
data.author: Sondra Anice Barnes

data.quote: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration  I don't think you can go wrong.
data.author: Ella Fitzgerald

data.quote: You have to know exactly what you want out of your career. If you want to be a star  you don't bother with other things.
data.author: Marilyn Home

data.quote: Interest speaks all sorts of tongues  and plays all sorts of parts  even that of disinterestedness.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: Men's actions depend to a great extent upon fear. We do things either because we enjoy doing them or because we are afraid not to do them.
data.author: John F. Milburn

data.quote: Some people change their ways when they see the light  others when they feel the heat.
data.author: Caroline Schoeder

data.quote: There are only two forces that unite men-fear and interest.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: The passion to get ahead is sometimes born of the fear lest we be left behind.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: You can't underestimate the power of fear.
data.author: Patricia Nixon

data.quote: There are only two stimulants to one's best efforts: the fear of punishment  and the hope of reward.
data.author: John M. Wilson

data.quote: A man who is afraid will do anything.
data.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

data.quote: Fear of losing is what makes competitors so great. Show me a gracious loser and I'll show you a permanent loser.
data.author: O. J. Simpson

data.quote: A team that has character doesn't need stimulation.
data.author: Tom Landry

data.quote: Beware of trying to accomplish anything by force.
data.author: Angela Merici

data.quote: People who fight fire with fire usually end up with ashes.
data.author: Abigail Van Buren

data.quote: Because it's there.
data.author: G. H. L. Mallory

data.quote: Diplomacy is the art of letting someone have your way.
data.author: Daniele Vare

data.quote: It is easier to influence strong than weak characters in life.
data.author: Margot Asquith

data.quote: Men are not against you  they are merely for themselves.
data.author: Gene Fowler

data.quote: No punishment has ever possessed enough power of deterrence to prevent the commission of crimes. On the contrary  whatever the punishment  once a specific crime has appeared for the first time  its reappearance is more likely than its initial emergence could ever have been.
data.author: Hannah Arendt

data.quote: When the flag is unfurled  all reason is in the trumpet.
data.author: Ukrainian proverb

data.quote: No leader can be too far ahead of his followers.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: You will accomplish more by kind words and a courteous manner than by anger or sharp rebuke  which should never be used except in necessity.
data.author: Angela Merici

data.quote: As long as I have a want  I have a reason for living. Satisfaction is death.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Where the willingness is great  the difficulties cannot be great.
data.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

data.quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.
data.author: Katherine Mansfield

data.quote: Love makes the wildest spirit tame  and the tamest spirit wild.
data.author: Alexis Delp

data.quote: Great men undertake great things because they are great  fools  because they think them easy.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: We must each find our separate meaning in the persuasion of our days until we meet in the meaning of the world.
data.author: Christopher Fry

data.quote: Fear  desire  hope still push us on toward the future.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: It is for the superfluous things of life that men sweat.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca
